result.execSummary:
The defendant Iesha W Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In lieu of payment, defendant is to serve an additional 5 days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight Time.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Straight Time.
Apply 107 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Case 14CM2110.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Shawn Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Iesha W Edwards in court, in custody, with attorney Justin Singleton.   

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Penalty enhancer is struck.


Court orders the following:
150 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Concurrent to Waukesha County Case 14CM2110
107 Days Credit.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
In Lieu of Payment - Defendant to Serve an Additional 5 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.

Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Iesha W Edwards in court, in custody, with attorney Justin Singleton.   

Matter originally scheduled for a Motion to Suppress.  However, parties have reached an agreement and the Motion is resolved.
Therefore, defense withdraws their motion.
Defense requests the matter be scheduled for PLEAS.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
to Suppress Fruits of Illegal Search filed by Attorney Singleton.
